unnormalised: New Delhi: Navigating India's roads requires a solid understanding of the Motor Vehicles Act and its evolving regulations. Experts at IIT-Delhi are constantly analyzing traffic flow and accident data to recommend improvements, implemented by bodies like the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.

unnormalised: One crucial update effective from 01/01/2024 concerns lane discipline on highways. Driving in the right lane is now strictly enforced for slower vehicles. Over-speeding, especially around school zones (like near DPS, RK Puram), carries hefty fines. The challan amount can be upwards of Rs. 5000, depending on the severity.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the use of mobile phones while driving is rigorously monitored with increased CCTV surveillance. Remember, hands-free devices are recommended. Remember to check your vehicle's PUC (Pollution Under Control) certificate regularly; failing to do so can result in a fine. You can renew your PUC at designated centers until 17:00 hrs daily. Drive safe and abide by the rules to ensure a smooth journey for everyone. The next review of these regulations is scheduled for 15/08/2024.
